trans-unit.source: Sample Data in Azure Blob Storage
trans-unit.target: Sample Data in Azure Blob Storage

trans-unit.source: This document covers sampling data stored in Azure Blob Storage by downloading it programmatically and then sampling it with sample Python code.
trans-unit.target: This document covers sampling data stored in Azure Blob Storage by downloading it programmatically and then sampling it with sample Python code.

trans-unit.source: The steps to do so are as follows:
trans-unit.target: The steps to do so are as follows:

trans-unit.source: Download the data from Azure blob storage using the blob service from the following sample Python code:
trans-unit.target: Download the data from Azure blob storage using the blob service from the following sample Python code:

trans-unit.source: Read data into a Pandas data-frame from the file downloaded above.
trans-unit.target: Read data into a Pandas data-frame from the file downloaded above.

trans-unit.source: Down-sample the data using the `numpy`'s `random.choice` as follows:
trans-unit.target: Down-sample the data using the `numpy`'s `random.choice` as follows:

trans-unit.source: Now you can work with the above data frame with the 1 Percent sample for further exploration and feature generation.
trans-unit.target: Now you can work with the above data frame with the 1 Percent sample for further exploration and feature generation.

trans-unit.target: Upload data and read it into Azure Machine Learning
